definition[0]: the money charged for sending a letter, package etc by post
example[0]: How much is the postage for a postcard?
example[1]: It’s yours for £13.99, including postage and packing.
definition[1]: the money charged for delivering letters, parcels etc
example[2]: The industry’s biggest cost variables are postage, paper and printing.
example[3]: The annual subscription is $60, plus $2 postage and handling.
definition[2]: if you send a postage paid envelope, card etc to a company, the cost of sending it has already been paid and there is no need to use a stamp
example[4]: Every month, more than 200 people receive the survey, which comes with a postage paid return envelope.
definition[3]: a charge made for the cost of packing and sending something you have bought
example[5]: All books are offered at 20% below publishers’ prices (plus postage and packing).
